newsitem.title: USA: Kansas fall crops ahead of average pace.
newsitem.headline: Kansas fall crops ahead of average pace.

text.p: Fall crops in Kansas were rated mostly good to excellent during the week ended Sunday and crop progress continued ahead of average pace, the state's agricultural statistics service said.

Corn was rated 83 percent good to excellent, 12 fair and five poor to very poor. Ninety-eight percent of the corn was in the dough stage or beyond, ahead of 79 percent last year and the average of 93 percent.
Sorghum condition was rated 85 percent good to excellent, 12 fair and three percent poor to very poor. The crop was 99 percent headed, compared with the average of 91 percent.
Soybeans were rated 82 percent good to excellent, 16 percent fair and two percent poor.
Insect infestation was rated 40 percent light, 17 percent moderate and four severe and 39 no infestation. The most common insects reported were corn earworms and grasshoppers.
Soil moisture was rated seven percent short, 83 percent adequate and 10 percent surplus.
Pasture and range were rated 78 percent good to excellent, 19 percent fair and three percent poor.
"Because of rains in many areas, pastures are in unusually good condition for this time of year," the report said.
